content: The Act may be cited as the "Medicare Diabetes Self-Management Training Act of 2007". Congress finds that diabetes is a major public health threat in the US, with 21 million people currently living with diabetes and 54 million with pre-diabetes. Diabetes is the 6th leading cause of death, causing 224,000 deaths annually, and its prevalence has tripled in the last 30 years. Diabetes self-management training, also known as diabetes education, equips patients with essential knowledge and skills to effectively manage their diabetes and reduce the risk of developing related health issues like heart disease and stroke.
